articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States is monitoring a troubling Serbian military deployment along the border of Kosovo that is destabilizing the area, the White House said on Friday and called for the forces to be withdrawn.
articles.title: US monitoring large Serbian force along Kosovo border, White House says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Authorities in the western Ukrainian region of Vinnytsya ordered an evacuation early on Saturday, saying an infrastructure site had been struck in a Russian attack.
articles.title: Russian attack hits site in western Ukraine, limited evacuation ordered

articles.author: Richard Cowan
articles.description: The death of trailblazing U.S. Senator Dianne Feinstein presented her fellow Democrats with two key questions on Friday: Who will replace her in the chamber and who will take her seat on the committee that approves federal judges.
articles.title: Feinstein's death poses two big questions for US Senate Democrats

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Nandita Bose, Idrees Ali
articles.description: Top U.S. general Mark Milley retired on Friday after a four-year tenure, saying in a speech that U.S. troops take an oath to the Constitution and not a "wannabe dictator," an apparent swipe at former President Donald Trump.
articles.title: Top US general Milley takes apparent jab at Trump as he retires

articles.author: Mohamed Junayd
articles.description: Voters lined up at hundreds of polling stations in the Maldives on Saturday in a run-off election for president of the Indian Ocean archipelago that pits the incumbent India-leaning leader against a strong pro-China contender.
articles.title: Maldives presidential run-off pits pro-India, pro-China figures

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Thai court denied bail on Saturday for an activist lawyer sentenced to four years in prison for royal insults, his lawyer said, in one of the Southeast Asian country's highest-profile lese-majeste cases.
articles.title: Thai court denies bail for lawyer who called for monarchy reforms

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Italy's coast guard rescued 177 people including 27 crew from a ferry that caught fire travelling from the Italian island of Lampedusa to Porto Empedocle in Sicily, it said on Saturday.
articles.title: Italy's coast guard rescues 177 people aboard burning ferry

articles.author: Andy Sullivan, David Morgan
articles.description: Lawmakers return to Congress on Saturday with no clear path to resolving a squabble that appears likely to close wide swaths of the federal government, from national parks to financial regulation, in less than 18 hours.
articles.title: Congress tees up votes in last-minute scramble to avert shutdown

articles.author: Dave Sherwood
articles.description: Cuban seamstress Yamidely Cervantes has bought a new sewing machine for the first time in years, plus a refrigerator and a cellphone - all on Russia's dime.
articles.title: How Cubans were recruited to fight for Russia

articles.author: Lisa Richwine, Steve Gorman
articles.description: An admitted former street gang leader was arrested on Friday on a charge of murder in the Las Vegas shooting death of hip-hop star Tupac Shakur nearly three decades ago, a long-unsolved crime that became a defining moment in the history of rap music.
articles.title: Suspect in rapper Tupac Shakur's 1996 slaying charged with murder in Las Vegas
